intro: Elaeodendron artense, commonly known as the Artense elaeodendron, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks or in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features include a woody stem with smooth bark and small, clustered fruits that contain seeds with a hard coat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
